result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek James Milbradt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek James Milbradt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek James Milbradt was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail term is to commence within 30 days of 9/17/18
Contraband evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:08 am - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Derek James Milbradt appeared with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. JOC was entered in this matter. DA states recommendation. Court imposes:

$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
5 days jail to commence within 30 days of 9/17/18

Pay plan of $50 per month beginning 10/1/18 and each month thereafter until paid in full or CO

Contraband evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

10:35 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Derek James Milbradt appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states facts of case.  DE still has not complied with terms of agreement, re AODA and Batterers.  Court questions DE regarding being late for court.  Court accepts DE explanation.  DA asks that judgment be entered.  Granted by Court.  To be scheduled for sentencing at a later date.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Bond to continue.  Adj 10:39 am.

DE had not complied with AODA provision.  DA states further contact with counseling.  DE claims he has no money to pay for counseling. Further discussion between DE and Court. Statement by DA.  Court adjourns motion hearing for 60 days out.  DE to schedule AODA immediately and bring proof to the court at next hearing.  Adj 11:16 am.

11:02 am - DA calls cases 16CM118, 16CM119, 16FO178 and 16FO179 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Derek James Milbradt appeared with attorney David Deda.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to the two citations.  Court finds DE guilty and orders fines of $169 on each forfeiture.  Pay plan of $50 per month beginning 6/30/17 and each month thereafter or CO.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 of 16CM118.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of a deferred JOC, and on motion of DA, dismisses Ct 2 on 16CM118 and 16CM119 in its entirety.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.

Judgment deferred 1 year.
See written order.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2017 at 11:00 am.
